intro: Gnidia flava, commonly known as the yellow gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest margins, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple and opposite, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Gnidia flava is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
